Wireless Technology Architect


  metaLogic Consulting Inc. (www.metalogic-inc.com) requires a Wireless Technology Architect for a services project, based in Toronto, Ontario, Canada.
This is a contract position, starting September 30, 2002. The project scope includes the migration of 100% of the existing access terminal clients of inquiry services to a secure extranet access delivery channel, delivering a secure, single point of access system complete with client management capabilities.

The candidate skill requirements must include:
- At least ten (10) years of related wireless and wireless architecture experience
- Experience with identifying resource requirements and developing a successful, high-level wireless implementation plan.
- Experience with electronic service delivery design and architecture.
- Proven experience in managing linkages and dependencies between various subprojects, external projects and service providers.

Highly desireable skills include:
- Strong IT systems integration, development, analysis & design experience in a multi-tiered online, information based transaction delivery environment
- Multiple projects experience providing the vision for implementation wireless services
- Experience with architectural tools and techniques (Zachman Framework, UML, etc.)
- Knowledge of, and experience with Government of Ontario IT policies, procedures and standards such as Enterprise I&IT Architecture, architecture review process, common business model and application standards

Experience with the following platforms and computing environments is highly desirable:
- Mainframe environments
- Any wide area network, client/server environment
- Any Electronic Service Delivery environment
- Middleware communication standards (J2EE, .Net, XML)
- Oracle and/or DB2
- Unix, Windows NT/2K

The candidate is expected to have extensive experience in the wireless industry and will serve as a subject matter expert on implementing wireless solutions, play a key (expert) role, and provide technical advice and strategies involving wireless technologies and opportunities.
They must have a demonstrated ability to manage vendors, write detailed specifications to be used in the tendering process, and manage the vendor selection process. He/she will work closely with the Project Director and with a number of other teams involved with this rollout, through to implementation.

Responsibilities will include but are not limited to:
- Enable the introduction, integration and use of technologies across the wireless platform;
- Develop and document a detailed statement of requirements for the proposed wireless system;
- Collaborate with users to determine content, data processing and capacity requirements, user access levels, software and hardware requirements;
- Analyze functional requirements to identify information, procedures and decision flows;
- Conduct technical feasibility studies of proposed solutions in order to evaluate the technical issues and options of the proposals as well as the technical impact, costs and risks to the project;
- Develop technical architecture designs to meet specific project requirements while adhering to standards and overall direction;
- Provide assistance to other team members for designing and managing wireless architecture;
- Recommend and utilize technologies to secure data and ensure access only to qualified users;
- Prepare implementation plans for particular technologies;
- Provide strategic technical guidance to other members of the team to develop cross-platform wireless and mobile systems;
- Evaluate and recommend architecture design for wireless applications using Java, C++, WAP, XML, HTTP, WebServer, TCP/IP protocols
- Provide policy development process to participate in the development of standard architectural infrastructure and service delivery recommendations as part of the project team
- Advise developers of Web based application systems on the wireless access implication of their designs
